title: CVD - Cumulative Volume Delta
content:
Cumulative Volume Delta (CVD) means cumulative delta for a certain period of time. If classic Delta shows the difference between market buys and sells for each bar separately, Cumulative Delta displays the entire dynamics of balance of market buys and sells starting from a certain point of time (from the beginning of a trading session or contract).

To add and set up the indicator, open the Indicators settings window.


Indicator's settings

Settings

NameDescription
Visual Mode Represents one of the chart presentation options.

Options:
  • Candles
  • Bars
  • Line
Session delta mode Represents one of the session modes.

Options:
  • None
  • Default
  • Custom session
Custom session start Specifies the start of the custom session
Use scale When enabled, show values ranging from 0 to the maximum if the minimum is positive, and from 0 to the minimum if the maximum is negative.

Alerts

NameDescription
Use alerts Enables or disables the sound notification.
Alert File This parameter allows users to specify the name of a custom audio file for alert sounds. Users can select a WAV file that will be played whenever an alert condition is triggered. The chosen WAV file should be located in the folder C:\Program Files (x86)\ATAS Platform\Sounds.
Required Change Sets the value at which the alert is triggered.
Font Color Sets the color of the text in the alert window.
Background Sets the background color of the alert window.

Drawing

NameDescription
Positive Displays the color of an element with a positive value.
Negative Displays the color of an element with a negative value.
Text Color Defines the text color for the price axis label.
Border color Sets the color for the element's border.
Mode Allows you to select one of the available display modes for this element.
Show value Determines whether to display values in the label.
Visible Determines whether to display this element.
Width Defines the thickness of lines or elements in the chart
Line style Specifies the dash pattern used for lines in the chart, allowing selection of styles like solid, dotted, dashed, or custom patterns for visual differentiation

Misc

NameDescription
Show description The parameter controls the visibility of the indicator's name and its parameters on the chart, enabling the display of this information to be toggled on or off.

Lines

NameDescription
Zero Displays zero level.

Properties
NameDescription
ScaleIf this option is enabled, the scale with the specified value is used, otherwise it is automatic.
ColorDetermines the color of the displayed line.
Line styleSpecifies the dash pattern used for lines in the chart, allowing selection of styles like solid, dotted, dashed, or custom patterns for visual differentiation

Options:
  • Solid
  • Dash
  • Dot
  • Dash Dot
  • Dash Dot Dot
WidthDetermines the width of the displayed line.
ValueDefines the numeric level corresponding to this line.
TextDefines the text in the displayed label.
Draw above priceDetermines whether the visual elements are drawn above or below the price data on a chart. When enabled, it overlays the indicator's graphics over the price plot.
Ignored by alertsSpecifies whether the value of this data series should be ignored by the alerts set for drawing objects.
